events.originalText: Two passenger trains collided near Szczekociny, Poland, resulting in 16 deaths and 58 injuries.
events.subtitle: Szczekociny rail crash
events.headline: Two Trains Collide in Szczekociny, Poland: 16 Dead, 58 Injured

events.originalText: Motorist Rodney King was beaten by Los Angeles Police Department officers during an arrest, causing public outrage that increased tensions between the African-American community and the police department over police brutality and social inequality.
events.subtitle: Rodney King
events.headline: Rodney King Beaten by LAPD Officers, Sparks Outrage

events.originalText: The British rock band Jethro Tull released Thick as a Brick, a parody concept album allegedly adapted from an eight-year-old boy's epic poem.
events.subtitle: Jethro Tull (band)
events.headline: Jethro Tull Releases Parody Concept Album 'Thick as a Brick'

events.originalText: A Polish Home Army unit massacred at least 150 Ukrainian civilians in Pawłokoma, Poland.
events.subtitle: Home Army
events.headline: Polish Home Army Unit Massacres 150 Ukrainian Civilians in Pawłokoma

events.originalText: The Ottoman Caliphate, the world's last widely recognized caliphate, was abolished.
events.subtitle: Ottoman Caliphate
events.headline: Ottoman Caliphate Abolished, Last Widely Recognized Caliphate

events.originalText: Thousands of women marched in Washington, D.C. "in a spirit of protest" against the exclusion of women from American society.
events.subtitle: Woman Suffrage Procession
events.headline: Thousands of Women March in Washington, D.C. Against Exclusion

events.originalText: Shoshone National Forest, in the U.S. state of Wyoming, was established as the country's first national forest.
events.subtitle: Shoshone National Forest
events.headline: Shoshone National Forest Established in Wyoming

events.originalText: The first indoor game of ice hockey was played at the Victoria Skating Rink in Montreal by James Creighton and students of McGill University.
events.subtitle: First indoor ice hockey game
events.headline: First Indoor Ice Hockey Game Played in Montreal

events.originalText: French composer Georges Bizet's opera Carmen (poster pictured), based on the novella of the same title by Prosper Mérimée, premiered at the Opéra-Comique in Paris.
events.subtitle: Georges Bizet
events.headline: Georges Bizet's Opera Carmen Premieres in Paris

events.originalText: The U.S. Congress passed the Missouri Compromise, which balanced the admission of Missouri as a slave state with that of Maine as a free state.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: US Congress Passes Missouri Compromise

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Samuel Nicholas and the Continental Marines successfully landed on New Providence in the Bahamas and began a raid of Nassau, capturing the port the next day.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Continental Marines Raid Nassau in the Bahamas

events.originalText: The Statute of Rhuddlan was enacted, introducing English common law to the Principality of Wales.
events.subtitle: Statute of Rhuddlan
events.headline: Statute of Rhuddlan Introduces English Common Law to Wales
